## Event Overview

The Junior Summer School 2025 is a fun, interactive two-week program designed specifically for teenagers (15-18 years old) who want to explore technology in a friendly, engaging environment. No prior technical experience required – just bring your curiosity and creativity!

## Program Details

Over these exciting two weeks, teens will:

- Learn digital skills through hands-on, project-based activities
- Create their own podcast from scratch
- Understand online safety and privacy in the digital world
- Explore the basics of Linux and command line in a fun, gamified way
- Make new friends who share similar interests
- Present creative projects to showcase their new skills

## Curriculum

### Week 1: Digital Exploration & Safety

| Day | Morning | Afternoon |
|-----|---------|----------|
| Monday | Welcome & Digital World Introduction | Team Building Tech Games |
| Tuesday | Intro to Linux: Command Line Adventures | Social Media Safety Workshop |
| Wednesday | Digital Privacy: Protecting Yourself Online | Online Identity & Footprint Activities |
| Thursday | Understanding AI: How It Works & Impacts | AI Ethics Discussions & Games |
| Friday | Open Source Software Exploration | Multimedia Tools Introduction |

### Week 2: Creative Tech Projects

| Day | Morning | Afternoon |
|-----|---------|----------|
| Monday | Podcast Project: Planning & Scripting | Audio Recording Basics |
| Tuesday | Podcast Production: Recording Sessions | Audio Editing Workshop |
| Wednesday | Digital Art & Design Fundamentals | Project Work Time |
| Thursday | Project Work & Finalization | Rehearsal for Presentations |
| Friday | Project Showcase & Presentations | Celebration & Certificates |

## Fun Learning Modules


### Digital Literacy & Safety
- **Introduction to Unix/Linux**: Friendly first steps into the command line world with games and challenges
- **Social Media Risks & Safety**: Understanding privacy settings, recognizing scams, and protecting your online identity
- **AI Awareness**: How AI works, where you encounter it daily, and what risks to be aware of
- **Cyber Hygiene Basics**: Creating strong passwords, recognizing phishing, and keeping your devices secure

### Creative Technology
- **Open-Source for Multimedia**: Discover free tools for creating amazing digital content
- **Podcast Production**: Plan, record, edit and publish your own podcast on a topic you care about
- **Digital Storytelling**: Combine text, images, and audio to create compelling digital stories
- **Collaborative Creation**: Work with teammates to build something greater than you could alone

### Microlearning Fun Sessions
- **Command Line Treasure Hunts**: 30-minute adventures solving puzzles using basic Linux commands
- **Digital Detective Challenges**: 20-minute activities spotting online scams and misinformation
- **Tech News Discussions**: Brief daily chats about current technology topics (15 minutes)
- **Creative Tech Breaks**: Quick creative challenges using different digital tools (25 minutes)
- **Digital Rights Awareness**: Short interactive sessions about online rights and responsibilities (20 minutes)
- **Safe Social Media Challenges**: Fun activities to practice smart social media habits (30 minutes)
- **AI Art Experiments**: Brief sessions exploring AI image generation tools (25 minutes)
- **Open Source Explorations**: Quick introductions to cool open source projects (20 minutes)

## Who Should Attend

- Teens (15-18 years old) curious about technology
- Young people interested in digital creativity and content creation
- Students who want to learn practical digital skills in a fun environment
- Teenagers who want to better understand online safety and privacy
- No prior technical experience required!

## Frequently Asked Questions

### What should I bring?
Bring a laptop if you have one (we can provide one if needed), headphones, and your creativity! All software and materials will be provided.

### Do I need to know how to code?
Not at all! This program is designed for beginners with no prior technical experience required.

### Will there be breaks and social time?
Absolutely! We include plenty of breaks, social activities, and team-building games throughout each day.

### Is lunch provided?
Yes, lunch and snacks are included in the program fee.

## What's Next

After completing the Junior Summer School, teens are encouraged to continue their tech journey with these opportunities:

- **[Computer Club](/academy/programs/computerclub/)** - Weekly meetings during the school year
- **[SpaceApps Challenge Junior Division](/academy/programs/hackathons/spaceapps/challenge-2025.qmd)** - October 3-5, 2025
- **[Cybersecurity Basics Workshop](/academy/programs/hackathons/cybersecurity-hackathon.qmd)** - March 15-17, 2025
- **[Academy Resources](/academy/)** - Online self-paced learning materials
